Articles.Content:
Hello!, I'm DogeNut aka The Best Rocket Pilot (That is far from being true). I have been playing KSP since 0.23 which back then I was more like a Crazed Kerbal who thought that aiming right at the moon works and things that make logical sense but little did I know that that's a bunch of crazy talk and boloney! And I didn't get into actually play the game and do everything without using hyperedit and that was... Now! That's right after a year of not playing KSP I came back and starting learning how to play, and land on the mun Duna, Annd right what I'm doing landing on duna using bare bone knowledge of interplanetary travel. They said landing the mun is hard, Its actually hard to land on the north pole (Which I very much did land on the north pole).

Anyways Enough of me rambling about how great my piloting skills are (Oh surely Doge you must be so great at it) and yeah I wasted 11 years in KSP waiting for a angle... Angles are slow and rage inducing to look at.

Also I did a rescue mission on the mun which I landed 8.7km from a crash site so that is close (What a bunch of crazy talk). Anyways I'm going top this off with a picture!

Hi Dogenutt. The Imgur link you want is the BBCode option. I tried to fix it for you, but I can never remember how since Imgur hid the link options of other people's pics. 

Anyway, welcome to the forum. 

Yay! TheClaw fixed it for you.
Welcome to the forum, the cake is over there and refreshments are out back.

Hello Dogenutt and welcome to the forum!

Nice pic.  Glad to hear you are enjoying the learning curve.

Happy landings!
